snippet: The Federal Aviation Administration said Friday that it would halt the closings, part of a $637 million spending reduction at the agency, until June to allow for safety analyses.
abstract: Federal Aviation Administration says it will delay closing control towers at 149 airports until June 2013 to allow for safety analyses; closings had been planned as part of $637 million spending reduction at agency required under across-the-board budget cuts known as the sequester.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Aviation Administration said Friday that it would halt the closings, part of a $637 million spending reduction at the agency, until June to allow for safety analyses.

headline.seo: F.A.A. Will Delay Closings of Airport Towers Forced by Sequestration
headline.main: F.A.A. Delays Closings of Airport Towers Forced by Cuts
headline.print_headline: F.A.A. Delays Closings of Airport Towers Forced by Cuts
